oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BREAKER BAR FORMATION AND MIGRATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Grasmeijer, Bart T.
van Rijn, Leo C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breaker bar
bar formation
bar migration
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The formulation of Isobe and Horikawa (1982) is modified and adapted for use in a probabilistic cross-shore transport model (CROSMOR). Computed changes of wave height, peak near-bed orbital velocity and depth-averaged return flow are compared to laboratory measurements. A comparison is made between computed and measured bedprofile changes for a large scale laboratory experiment.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
